ASA’s Partnership Dialogue Series: A Focus on Communication
Dear {!Contact.FirstName},
It's not too late for you to RSVP to participate in ASA's Partnership Dialogue Series: A Focus on Communication.
As part of our Partnership Dialogue Series, we’re proud to host an exchange among our colleagues in Phoenix Arizona on February 26, 2008. In this upcoming series, we will explore the challenges of effectively communicating with students and families today. With the overwhelming array of media available, ranging from podcasts to phone calls and text messages, which methods do you feel comfortable using? And which methods are the most effective for your millennial students and Baby Boomer parents?
Our Partnership Dialogue Series will afford you the opportunity to join in an interactive presentation followed by round table discussions. Be educated, ask questions, and receive feedback from colleagues American Student Assistance on one of the hottest topics affecting financial aid offices across the country.
Agenda:
8:30 - 9:00 Continental Breakfast 9:00 - 12:00 Discussion and Exchange of Ideas 12:00 - 1:00 Lunch
February 26, 2008 8:30 a.m. - 1:00 p.m. University of Phoenix, Hohokam Campus 4635 East Elwood Street Room 101/102 Phoenix, AZ 85040 http://www.phoenix.edu/campus_locations/campus_locations.aspx
Continental breakfast and lunch will be provided.
For more information please contact
Jean M. Russell Business Development American Student Assistance 800-999-9080 Ext. 6185 jrussell@amsa.com www.amsa.com
or
For registration and additional information, including driving directions, please visit www.amsa.com/fap/training, e-mail your name, phone number and enrollment details to training@amsa.com, or call the Training Department at 800.999.9080, ext. 3099. I hope you can join us, and look forward to seeing you there.
Thank you, {!Contact.OwnerFullName} {!Contact.OwnerEmail}
